item.description:
The Great Pyramid Game is an epic test of mental agility with a high degree of competitive tension. Play it seriously or for fun - with 4 players or 1. Mums and Dads test your powers of observation against the kids!

Unfold your pyramid into a beautiful three-dimensional structure on which you can play three exciting pyramid games for 2 or 4 players, plus a mind blowing solo version.

The Great Pyramid Game will stretch your speed of recognition to the limit in a race against another player. A game of EPIC proportions.

—description from the publisher

In Let's Make a Bus Route (ãƒã‚¹ãƒ«ãƒ¼ãƒˆã‚’ã¤ãã‚ã†), you and others each control a bus company in Kyoto and are creating new bus lines to respond to the needs of local students, the elderly, and tourists and commuters visiting the city, while also trying to avoid traffic jams. Can you bring people by sightseeing spots while also getting them to their destinations? Which lines will be most pleasing to users?

The game includes a large shared map board, along with five individual player boards. All players draw their routes on the shared board, while taking note of their passengers, sights, and other elements on their individual boards.

To start a round, you reveal a colored bus route at random from the deck. Each player's board has a different combination of colors and required moves, so blue on one board might be go straight one block, while someone else goes two blocks and a third player must make a turn. Players make their moves in turn on the shared map board, then mark the icons of what they've seen at various intersections on their player board. Different types of riders all score differently, and placing checks on your personal board for passengers and areas (sight-seeing spots, stations, universities) before other players do can earn you extra bonus points, so strategically planning your route while keeping in mind your main destinations is very important. Sharing the road with someone else causes traffic, which might lead to penalties. Meet the conditions on public demand cards to score bonus points!

item.description:
Description
Bike Race is a fast-paced road bicycle racing game for 2 to 4 players where each of them controls a team made up of three cyclists: the Peloton, the Duo, and the Sprinter. The goal is to cross the finish line with your cyclists before your opponents to get the highest amount of points.

Gameplay
Each player controls a team composed of one Sprinter, one Duo, and one Peloton. The starting player chooses 3 Movement Tokens, shakes them up in hands and and then drops them on the table. The visible sides show the actions which can be taken. The player then selects 2 Movement Tokens to move 2 cyclists. The next player does the same, this is repeated until all players have completed their moves. The end of the game is reached when all the cyclists have passed the finish line (red flags). At the end of the game the points obtained by the cyclists are summed up to establish the winner.

Tracks
A total of 11 double side track cards may be assembled to form various tacks. The game come with 2 standard tracks but the players may use the cards to build new tracks. A card with an Intermediate Line is available too.

Features
The Cyclists do not only have standard movements, each cyclist type features a special movement: Sprint, Catch up and Slipstream.

Game Official Website

Loosely based on poker Texas hold 'em poker card game but without a bidding phase. The game is played over several rounds and has more strategic decisions to make because you have more knowledge and influence of the cards.

Components required:
Standard deck of 52 cards.
Pen and paper for keeping score.

Won 2nd place in the 2018 54-Card Game Design Contest for Best Game Using a Standard 54-Card Deck.

Innkeeper Brewers is a quick 2-player game where players are two opposing Inn landlords, racing to be the best inn-keepers in the village by providing the villagers with beer as quickly as possible, and have the nicest Inn in the village too, by upgrading it with fancy nick-nacks. Harvest barley, brew it into beer, sell that beer to villagers, then invest your well-earned money for Victory Points (VPs), and/or buy Inn upgrades to improve your Inn!

On your turn, you move your pawn along its assigned row/column of a 4x4 action grid, to activate the action on the card in the grid that is the cross-reference of your pawn and your opponent's pawn. Wherever you move to on your turn will influence which actions your opponent has available on their next turn!

Actions include gaining barley, brewing barley into beer, selling beer to the villagers at various sale rates, exchanging money for VPs, or spending money on upgrades for your Inn. Inn Upgrades provide the player with special unique powers they can then use for the rest of the game.

The game ends once one player reaches 20 VPs, or all the Inn upgrade cards are bought; the other player takes a final turn, then the player with the most VPs is the winner!

-description from designer

Shield your butts, get other poopers in trouble, occupy a secret space and keep your dignity as a human being until the end against an incoming poop.

Ninja Pooper: On The Beach is a really stupid, but funny card game. You and your friends compete to be the first ninja pooper who poop without getting caught. The deck is made up of cards that forcing your opponent to put down multiple cards by attack cards, detecting other pooper's secret space or skipping the next player's turn. shield your butts using cork stopper or seek a secret space, else if you'll be forced to poop at a public place.

The "Ninja Pooper" core deck is 72 cards; the "Real Ninja" expansion pack is 36 cards. The gameplay is designed for up to five players.

—description from the publisher

The Landor Syndicate, a pirate alliance in an area of space controlled by the Lunar Orion Order, needs a new leader. The outgoing Supreme Admiral is looking for his replacement. Players take on the role of rival captains recruiting crews, capturing rival pirates, and collecting treasure.

Pirate Tricks is a trick-taking game for 3 to 5 players with a unique scoring system. The game is played over three hands. Each hand has different scoring goals. Once the scoring cards are revealed, the players are dealt five cards. Then players each bid on another 7 cards to complete their hands.

As the players bid for cards, they will look to gain certain cards that will boost their scores. While taking tricks, the players will need to be mindful of the different factions of pirates as some will score higher than others or may be worth negative points. At the end of the hand the players will collect treasure based on how well they matched the treasure scoring card. During some hands the players will want to get as many tricks as possible, other hands they will want to have few to no tricks, or they may have to match a predicted number of tricks taken.

Play continues for three hands. New scoring cards are revealed before each hand. After three hands, whichever player has gathered the most treasure will be proclaimed the next Supreme Admiral of the Landor Syndicate.

item.description:
Children's game based on a 1990 film which in turn is based on Astrid Lindgren's story about Bertil, a boy who befriends Nils, a diminutive person living in a rat's nest under the floor (the previous rat occupant being Nils's landlady and the antagonist of the film).

In the game, players take on the role of different instances of Bertil, tasked with collecting doll's house furniture, scraps of food, and matches for firewood in order to furnish Nils's home. This is done by rolling dice or turning over tiles. Hazards include the rat appearing to collect rent (in food), and the neighbour distracting Bertil with games of Pachisi.

—user summary

Point Blank is Lock 'n Load Tactical World War 2 card game for 2 players pitted against each other in situational combat scenarios.

There is also a solo option as well as partnerships in teams of 2.

Each scenario presents the players with a unique situation involving squads of men, support weapons, leaders and individual armored fighting vehicles.

This edition of the game pits the forces of the USA against Germany just after the landings in Normandy (June 1944) through October 1944. Each player has victory conditions determined by the scenario in which to defend or take objectives, seek and destroy their opponent’s units or one of many other different scenario objectives.

The game is played on an abstract map board made up of terrain cards in the game and managed through a distance system that accounts for the range to targets, line of sight and defensive attributes. The player has units that start out on the map and gradually work their way towards their objectives by advancing through the battlefield all the while conducting combat actions against their opponent or defending their troops from return fire or whatever hell that awaits them. Players draw cards from a common action deck where they will play actions on their units on the map board. The game is an IGOUGO impulse system and turns are managed when the action deck is exhausted. (Some scenarios may require multiple deck exhaustion to finish the game). Actions in the game consist of Fire, Move, Assault, Rally etc. The action cards contain dice icons on them to determine random results.

One of the unique features of the game is that it contains a deck of terrain cards that are not part of the action deck. As players change terrain they will draw a terrain card in which their moving units will occupy. Some action cards such as Recon helps players manage what terrain they occupy but your opponent may have other plans for your moving troops during their turn.
 Combat in the game is similar to how combat is conducted in Lock n Load Tactical. 2 players can play a game in about an hour (depending on the scenario size) and if you cannot find an opponent then try the game’s solo system. In general, the gameplay is fast and excited and compares to such legendary game systems as Up Front.

-description from publisher

Mouk and his friends had a nice vacation together on a sunny island but it's time for everybody to go back home.

Each player starts by picking randomly a friend token and searches for his home on the board. The goal is to be the first player to bring 4 of them back home by rolling the die and landing on the right spot.

In GiriGiri Curry, curry chefs (players) take turns adding ingredients in attempt to try and make the best tasting soup, meat, vegetable, or seafood curry. Each pot of curry has a recipe and a "balance limit." At the start of the game, chefs will look at one each for two different pots of curry. Be sure to watch what ingredients other chefs are adding to get a hint at what kind of recipe it is!

The different ingredients will add balance and taste to the pot of curry. Some ingredients are "secret ingredients" which also have a special ability, such as looking at the recipe or balance limit of a curry in which you've seen neither.

At any time, instead of adding an ingredient, a chef can claim a pot of curry, taking all the ingredient cards added, and is finished taking turns until all other chefs have also claimed a curry. If the ingredient balance exceeds the curry balance limit, then it can't be called curry and that chef scores no points. If under the limit, add up the ingredients taste and the chef with the best tasting curry wins!!

The second game on the Operational Scale Series. This game covers the American involvement in the Vietnamese War of 1965-1972.

In 1965, the United States decided to intervene in the ongoing conflict in Vietnam. This moment shaped the United States more than any other in the 20th Century. From the battlefield to the home front, the United States faced one of the greatest challenges in its history. Using the Operational Scale System as seen in Korea: Fire and Ice, OSS: Vietnam will show the conflict in a playable yet historical manner.

Players will negotiate the minefield of Publix opinion while attempting to win on the battlefield. The game covers the American involvement in the war (from 1965-1972) and offers players the options to expand the war in ways that few games on this conflict allow. The Americans can invade North Vietnam, Laos, or Cambodia at their own political risk - as can the Communist player.

-description from designer

name.value: Le Jeu Qui Rend Super Happy

item.description:
In order to reach the cloud of happiness and discover your gift from the other players, you have to climb the ladder of happiness as fast as you can.

Participate in several challenges to climb the ladder faster than your opponents:

- Qui es-tu ? : Vote on which player is better defined by the adjective and guess who the other players have voted for.
- Happy faces : Be the first to identify two cards with identical faces.
- Situations pourries : Find the best solution to a bad situation you might encounter in life!
- Bonheur général : Enjoy a break in the competition to just be nice to the other players, by complimenting them or giving free hugs.

Teach your kid how to dress according to the weather by associating pieces of clothing.

After picking a character card, the player has to find the three cards representing the clothes worn by the character and put them in the wardrobe. The wardrobe is then closed and the door on the back is open to reveal a character wearing the conbination of the three pieces of clothing. If it matches the character card, the player scores.
The game ends when all the character cards have been used.

For older kids (3+), the back of the character cards is used, showing only the background. Players have to find the correct pieces of clothing based on the weather.

You will need one of the Final Score College Basketball Year Books to play the game.

As the name implies, this quick play game provides you with a final score for a College Basketball game. Allowing you to rapidly play games and watch standings unfold before your eyes. However, there is more to the game than just generating scores. There is plenty of excitement and drama along the way, keeping the game play exciting and compelling. You will have nail biters, blow outs, and even a big upset or two.

Each team is rated individually for Offense, Defense, and Home Court Advantage. And while there will surely be some surprises along the way, since this is a game, after all, the accuracy of the game will astound you. We also have a normalization system for every team and season we rate, so you can play across seasons to determine the best team of all-time.

Zone à Défendre is a board game, cooperative, strategic, political (but not boring), from 1 to 6 players, from 14 years, duration of a game from 1h to 1h30.

You play as occupants of the ZAD of Notre-Dame-des-Landes in fight against a destructive and harmful airport project. To win you will have to build, sow, communicate, while preventing the progress of the police.

Play as a "ZADist" and defend these agricultural and wild lands and, beyond, the ideal of a world of simplicity and sharing. To stop bulldozers ransacking the hedgerows, you will have to acquire many skills: Cultivate your crops, learn the techniques of clown activism or of sabotage...or soirées around the fire to sustain the morale of activists! Multiply the building of cabins to slow down the progress of the bulldozers, place barricades to protect you from mobile gendarmes, mobilize external support and do not forget to harass the forces of order to demoralize them as much as possible...but beware the blows of their batons, the repression is ruthless...

Each player receives 24 stones in one color, of which 3 are to be used as blockers, and 2 dice each and a dice to increase during the game. The playing field consists of 2 pyramids and a cube area. In a pyramid are 21 boxes for inserting individual stones. The aim of the game is that each player uses his 21 stones in the pyramid of the playing field by throwing dice and then dices out of it. The insertion is done with two dice, with one stone each in the corresponding floor of the pyramid (from above) is used. The withdrawal must begin with a 1. Thereafter, the stones with the appropriate number out of the row can be diced or moved up. The blocker can be used with a rolled 1 in the top of the opposing pyramid. The opponent must not throw any more stones out until he can eliminate the blocker with a 1.

Each player takes one surfer and places him in his Windsurfing School (Start). The dice are then thrown in turn. Each player moves his surfer forwards according to the number of spots on the dice. When a player stops on a particular picture space, he has to follow the instructions on that space (for example, miss a turn). If two surfers stop on the same space, the surfer who is already on the space has to move six spaces back. He need not follow the instructions on the space on which he finally stops!
The winner is the Player who is the first to get back to the Surf School (Finish).

—user summary

name.value: Dragon Lords: The Battle of Darion

item.description:
Dragon Lords: The Battle of Darion is a skirmish-based card game, in which 1 to 4 players build armies and battle head to head. Armies are selected from dragons, knights, monsters, heroes and upgrades, while unique battle dice, Spells and Order cards are used to vanquish your enemy’s army.

—description from the publisher

From the publisher:

Do you think of yourself as an empathetic person? Are you good at reading other people’s feelings and emotions? Then Empatia is right for you! In Empatia you’ll try to guess what other players like, and what is not their cup of tea. Empatia is a game filled with marvelous eerie illustrations – and your task is to find among them the ones that other players like the best. You have to empathize with them to choose correctly; you have to discover why they like a given picture more than the others – Is it the colors? Shapes? The person in the middle? A cute animal? Empatia is not a game for the cold-hearted, that’s for sure!

- What’s in the box? 68 large-sized cards with illustrations; 12 cards with numbers; 6 plastic diamonds; 1 cardboard scoring sheet; 6 wooden player tokens; 36 cardboard tokens; rulebook
- Beautiful and magical artwork
- Easy-to-learn rules
- 2 game modes – competitive and cooperative

Gameplay (basic version):

Each player has 6 cards in their hands. One player will be the judge of the round and gets rid of one card of which he thinks he will not need during the next rounds. His fellow players all choose one card (or two if there are only two or three players) they think the judge will like most. The judge shuffles the cards. All pictures are then shown face up. The fellow players try and guess which two cards the judge likes most (and which of these two is the absolute top) and get points according to the accuracy of their guesses. The first player to get 30 points wins.

Gameplay (cooperative play)

Twelve cards are laid face up on the table. The first player must find a key of exactly two words (prepositions and conjunctions don't count) that matches 3 of the cards on the table. The fellow players must then try and find not only those 3 cards, but also in which order the player would line them up (from the one that matches best the key to the one that matches it only better than the 9 remaining cards). The team then gets points according to their answers.

The purpose is to get most point as a team. According to the number of points reached, you will know how well you know each other.

item.description:
From the back of the box:

The game will take you to a period 150 million years ago, to the time of the relentless battle among rabid predators, which defended their territory and attacked their enemies without remorse. 
Become one of them for a while and conquer the other dinosaurs. The game includes a game board, 1 dice, 4 figures, 4 colored stands and an instruction book. It is intended for 2, 3 or 4 players.

Gameplay:

The player with the dinosaur on a red stand starts the game. The player roll the die and moves forward towards the middle square (crossroads) by the corresponding number of squares. The players take turns to throw the die in a clockwise direction.

When a player reaches the middle square, they must select which direction to go next. If a player's figure approaches an opponent during their move they must finish their roll by moving away from them.

A player is removed from the game if his throw ends up on any of the start squares or when their move end beyond this start square. If a figure of any of the players lands between two other figures during the game and there are no free squares, it is removed from the game.

The player whose dinosaur is the last to remain on the board wins.

The board game Milujeme Slovensko (we love Slovakia) brings you fun and examines your knowledge.

There are interesting tasks awaiting players in Slovakia. By buying a cave, a mine, a harbor, or cableways, you will become a great investor who, however, has to deal efficiently with his property and money to make his profit grow and create a reserve of money for the tasks that are awaiting him during the game.

Buying real estate will ensure you some revenue from your opponents. The "number plate" cards will check your knowledge of numberplates in all of Slovakia's districts. Those cards are also given spice to by a bit of bet and risk. Your knowledge and finances can as well be boosted through quiz questions about Slovakia.

The game teaches you to invest and reasonably deal with finance, expands your knowledge of the country, while offering you the opportunity to spend time with your family and friends.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
This WWI German game (the title translates as "Our newest U-boats") is remarkable not only for its great cover and board art, but also for having game pieces that represent six specific German U-boats.
 Players roll and move alone a 100-space track from Helgoland around the UK and Ireland and back home. 20 English flag stickers wrapped around pins are placed in the 18 black spaces(three in number 6); each of these represents a historical sinking of a British ship. The first player to land on each black space collects its flag(s). Another 18 red-colored spaces represent events that force players to move forward or back along the track. The winner is the player who returns home with the most flags (first player home wins a tie).

The six metal U-boat pieces are numbered U-8, U-9, U-21, U-28, U-29 and U-45. According to Wikipedia, each has a notable history:

U-8: Sank 5 British ships on Feb. 23-24, 1915, then was trapped in nets and sunk by gunfire on March 4.

U-9: Sank the “Live Bait Squadron”, three Cressy-class armoured cruisers (HMS Cressy, Aboukir, Hogue), on Sept. 22, 1914 (space number 6 on the track), protected cruiser HMS Hawke on Oct. 15, 13 British merchant ships and one Russian naval vessel by Nov. 1915. Withdrawn for training use in April 1916. It was the only U-boat to be awarded an Iron Cross by Kaiser Wilhelm II.

U-21: One of the first U-boats to be equipped with diesel engines (U19 class). First submarine to sink a ship with a self-propelled torpedo on Sept. 5, 1914, destroying the cruiser HMS Pathfinder off the Firth of Forth. Transferred to the Mediterranean to support the Turks in early 1915, sinking British battleships HMS Triumph and HMS Majestic off Gallipoli, as well as French navy vessel Amiral Charner in Feb. 1916. Transferred to the Austrian navy for a time to attack Italian shipping, then back to Germany for unrestricted commerce war in March 1917. Retired for training in 1918. Merchant victims included 13 British, 7 Italian, 6 Dutch, 4 Norwegian, 2 French, 2 Russian, 2 Portuguese and 1 Swedish ships (2 damaged, rest sunk).

U-28: Sank 40 ships during five patrols, starting with British steamer Iberian on July 30, 1915. Was sunk on its final patrol after torpedoing British steamer Olive Branch, which exploded and fatally damaged U-28 in turn. No survivors.

U-29: Sank 4 and damaged 2 merchant ships during March 1915. Rammed and sunk by HMS Dreadnought in Pentland Firth on Mar. 18, the only submarine to be sunk by a battleship.

U-45: Sank 27 and damaged 1 ship between 27 April 1916 and 24 July 1917. Sunk by Royal Navy submarine D7 on 12 Sept. 1917.

—user summary

Mr. Natural is a Press Your Luck dice game for as many players as can sit around a table, played with six six-sided dice, in which the object is being the first player to score 10,000 points. Different single dice or dice combinations are worth from 50 to 1,500 points, depending on the combination. The name of the game comes from the highest-scoring combination, a natural 1 to 6 flush, called "a Mr. Natural" in the game.

The game was published in the issue 23 of The Thing Quarterly, an art periodical in form of an object. It consists of six ceramic six-sided dice and a fabric pouch, plus game instructions, contained in a cardboard box.

Each player takes a turn as Sophie the Otter, spinning for a seashell of a particular shape and pattern to add to their tableau. Once a player fills their tableau with one of each kind of seashell, they win the game. Players must use the Sophie the sitter grabber to retrieve their seashells from the ocean and move them to their tableau. The game promotes fine motor skills, pattern matching and recognition, taking turns, and social skills.
A team of boys takes on a team of girls in five different trivia rounds. The team with the highest number of correct answers wins.

name.value: Desert Sabre: the Operation Desert Storm Ground Campaign

item.description:
Desert Sabre is a light, fast-playing solitaire or team-play game of the Allied Coalition ground campaign in Operation Desert Storm to liberate Kuwait, defeat the Iraqi Army and Republican Guard, and seize key objectives to compell Iraq's removal from Kuwait in February 1991.

Played on a small (7x7 hexes) map of southern Iraq and Kuwait, the game includes 10 units representing select U.S. and Allied divisions, regiments and task forces. Iraqi units are not included, as the challenges the Allies faced advancing into Iraq and Kuwait are represented by a "C3I" die-roll to move mechanism of increasing difficulty as Allied units advance, reach key phase lines, and attempt to occupy up to 10 objectives on the map within four one-day turns (a fifth turn may be enabled by die-roll). Primarilly designed for solo play, up to three players can seperately maneuver the three main Allied higher commands: XVIII Corps, VII Corps, and the Allied and Marine joint task forces.

Reaching historical objectives will result in an Allied operational victory (taking about 6 objectives). Players may explore, at the risk of adverse "pol-mil effects" rolls, reaching additional objectives that offer prospects for a strategic victory. As a quick set-up, quick-playing game, the player can readily replay history to explore chances for a different, historical, better (or worse) outcome to the last great ground offensive of the 20th century.

Lost Ones is a map tile exploration game set in a "Choose Your Own Path" story. The player takes on the role of one of four available youths who have been kidnapped and taken to the Otherworld, home of the Fae. The game begins just as the player escapes captivity during a conflict between warring Fae factions and must now explore this magical realm of dreams to discover a way home. Besides solo play, there is a cooperative mode for 2-players where one player takes on the role of a powerful seer who helps guide the youth through her dreams.

The game is played over a set number of successive Turns, where the player can perform certain actions:

 Explore a new area by placing a map tile, moving there and reading the description in the Story Book
 Move to an adjacent map tile that has already been placed
 Activate certain Powers or Relics
 Investigate a map tile




 
When investigating a map tile, the character experiences a story encounter and may have to make choices on how to proceed. An encounter often requires a player to use an Ability card from their Hand that matches the difficulty level of the encounter. Success could mean learning more valuable information, overcoming an obstacle or even gaining Boon cards that grant magical powers and mythical relics. Exploring this realm of dreams will occasionally result in witnessing a terrifying Nightmare that will hinder progress and potentially lead to the character's doom. 
 The player must locate and find a way to open one of several Gateways to get home. This must be accomplished before running out of time, having an empty Hand or being caught by Fae sent to hunt the character. Careful use of resources, piecing together clues and acquiring special Boon cards are key to winning the game. Based on the choices made by the player, there are also a dozen different story endings with their own epilogues.

—description from the designer

item.description:
Hyperleague Racing is a table-top game inspired by a love of racing style video games like Mario Kart and Crash Team Racing amongst others.

Players become the pilots in highly customisable intergalactic racing leagues where they fly between race markers while swinging round moons, asteroids, black holes and other space themed terrain while performing a range of tricks and manoeuvres to get ahead or better still, crash their rivals in to space junk!

In the standard game, players either play as individual racers of their own design or use one of the pre-generated All-Star racers in ‘all against all’ 2-4 player action. Options exist to also play as a pair of racers racing against other pairs, demolition derby and a fun version affectionately called Puzzle Racer Turbo.

In Championship Mode however, the player takes the role of a fresh faced racer from one of the factions and as the campaign progresses, the pilot gains Championship Points to spend on upgrading their pilot, ship or garage.

Each turn, players activate their racer and make a simple race action followed by up to 3 manoeuvres and then a trick. A typical player turn takes minutes and every action is a balance of risk vs. reward. This creates a straight forward but fast paced balanced game that suits gamers that like a game that can be played quickly as a fun 30 minute blast or by players that want a more tactical game.

YOU are a lobbyist for a major firm. A bill vital to the firm's survival is scheduled for a vote in 5 (FIVE!) days. The balance is even. Four Representatives are still on the fence- and their votes will make or break the bill. Can you convince at least three of the Representatives to vote your way? Or will your nemesis- ACE Lobbyist- manage to derail your actions and kill the bill???? The cards are in your hands...

The game uses a standard deck of cards (including both Jokers) and is for a single player.

During setup, the player will identify four representatives (Queens and/or Kings- one of each suit) and will stack the ACE Lobbyist with their cards. Play starts with the drawing of cards to determine the actions for the day. Cards are played above a representative to influence them your way, or can be played to investigate the target of the ACE Lobbyist. The ACE Lobbyist will then get a turn by revealing and matching a card from their deck- these cards work against your influence.

After 5 turns (days) the game ends. If you have played enough cards (represented by the number of the card) to convince three of the four representatives to your side, you win!

—description from the designer

name.value: React!: The Organic Chemistry Board Game

item.description: REACT! players are chemists who compete to transform molecules. Each player is a chemist running their own laboratory. The goal of each chemist is to draw and match the correct substrate and reagent cards to discover real organic chemistry reactions and synthesize their own target compounds. The first chemist to discover the correct reactions and draw the completed structure of their target molecule wins!

name.value: Game Box: Family Feud – Disney Edition

item.description: Survey says... the card game based on the popular TV show Family Feud. Give the most popular answers to a variety of Disney themed survey questions to win.

name.value: The Coin Tribes' Revolt: Boudica's Rebellion Against Rome

item.description:
It is 60 AD. Romans have occupied the wild lands of Britannia, and exist in an uneasy peace with the tribes of the land… When the Iceni king dies, Roman greed triggers a rebellion led by the Iceni queen Boudica that tears across the south-east of Britain. With the Roman forces spread elsewhere in Britain, the revolt could forever change the course of history.

This is an asymmetrical game of warring factions set in the turbulent times during the early Roman occupation of Britain. It is inspired by the COIN series of games by Volko Runke, published by GMT, and attempts to recreate the GMT COIN Series game experience within the restrictions of the 9 card nano game format..

This is an entry into the 2018 9 card nano game contest. Original WIP thread: https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1943861/wip-coin-tribes-revolt-2018-9-card-nanogame-pnp-co

link.value: 9 Card Game Print and Play Design Contest

item.description:
Pilots of Gallaxia is a sci-fi space rescue adventure set in the Gallaxia and Oyrigin movie universe.

Game play in the first rescue mission is simplified to give new players ease of access. Pilots start with two ships and claim trade spaces between planets on their way to rescuing their scientist. Completed trade routes speed pilots back to their home hangar as they play fuel cards to be the first one home.

Unique elements of the game include a press-your-luck mechanic for drawing new cards, randomized prism-jump risk, free vortex travel and a battle system.

The more complex variant introduces the use of Durriken mercenaries, endurance routes that block other players and a Darkstorm card that clears the board and removes effects. A new deck of Captain’s Cards is also added and rewards player-pilots for fully completing the press-your-luck card draw with ‘take-that’ moments. Lastly, the infamous Durriken Staring Contest is a way to resolve Durriken battles.

—description from the designer

It's a combination of games like Yahtzee with D&D. The result is a fast-paced, fun, dice-rolling game based on my popular Journal of an Outlaw book series!
Each character plays a rogue trying to open a treasure chest that is protected by 10 locks. Each player takes turns rolling their polyhedral dice to see if they make the combination and open the locks. If unsuccessful at opening a lock, they arm a trap. They get one more chance to pick the lock, and failure means taking damage!

Players take turns trying to open their treasure chest, they are not only trying to get treasure, but must also live to the end! Hit points are exchanged for gold at the end of the game. Whoever winds up with the most gold wins! There are also special skills that can be earned to help your rogue achieve success.

From the designer's webpage

Istanbul: Big Box is the all-in-one package for Istanbul, including the base game as well as both expansions, Mocha & Baksheesh and Letters & Seals.

This combination also gives players the option to play on a big 5 x 5 tiles bazaar.

name.value: Radetzky's March: The Hundred Hours Campaign

item.description:
This game allows you to fight the 1849 campaign and the bloody battle of Novara

March 20th, 1849: the Piedmontese forces, about 85,000 men with just over a hundred guns, are positioned around Novara, ready to to cross the Ticino river and invade the Austrian territory, moving towards Milan, in an attempt to regain it.

Field Marshal Radetzky, commander in chief of the Austrian forces, 83 years old, conceives a daring plan: to concentrate all his forces, about 75,000 men with over 200 guns, right around Pavia, ready to cross the Ticino, quickly invade Piedmont and force the piedmontese army to a decisive battle.

Counters represent all the military forces of the time: Hussars, Uhlans, Dragoons, Line infantry, Grenzer, Jäger, Artillery, Bersaglieri, Pontoon Crew, Commanders.

On a very accurate map that took years of research, Austrians and Piedmontese troops engage in bloody attacks and retreats, cavalry charges, strategic movement, pontoon building ...

All these actions are performed by the players alternatively, but not in a conventional two-turn system. The game features a random activation mechanism that makes it always compelling and different, creating chaos and uncertainty, in a realistic and tense simulation.

The heart of the system is the command: simply check how many points you have in the turn, choose the formations you will activate, put them inside a mug; your opponent does the same, then mix and draw.

GAME SCALE
- Complexity: 2 out of 5 
- Solitaire Suitability: 4 out of 5 
- Time Scale: Three hours turn
- Map Scale: 1km/hex 
- Unit Scale: Regiments with their guns, battalions, two squadrons of cavalry
- Players: one or two 
- Playing Time: two to six hours

WHAT'S IN THE BOX?
- One 22 x 34 inch map (55,8 x 86,5 cm)
- 216 counters 
- Two player aid, colored cardboard (Terrain effect chart and Fast placement sheet) 
- Rule Booklet (with complete order of battle, game tips, campaign history and sources) 
- One 6-sided dice

Included scenarios - In addition to the basic game, there are some scenarios and variants that allow for shorter games and explore other strategies:
- Mortara and the Sforzesca, the Piedmontese attempt to stop the Austrian advance 
- Novara, the bloody final battle 
- Ramorino obeys orders; this scenario allows the Piedmontese to deploy the V division at the beginning of the game

In the dystopic 1930s, the industrial revolution pushed to the limit the exploitation of fossil-based resources, and now only powerful and unlimited hydroelectric energy is available to fulfill the thirst for power of the massive machines and unstoppable engineering progress.

Barrage is a resource management and strategic placement game in which players compete to build their majestic dams, raise them to increase their storing capacity of precious water, and deliver all the potential power through pressure tunnels connected to powerhouse energy turbines. Each player represents one of the international companies who are gathering machineries, innovative patents, and brilliant engineers to claim the best locations to capture and exploit the water power of a contested Alpine region crossed by rivers.

Barrage includes two innovative and challenging mechanisms. First, the construction wheel has to be managed by players to carefully plan their actions and handle their machineries since both your action tokens and resources are stored on the wheel and come back only after a full wheel round is completed. The more you construct and perform maintenance on your wheel, the earlier that resources and actions return to you.

Second, the water flow on the rivers depicted on the board is a shared and contested resource. Players have to intercept and store as much of the water as they can, build dams (upstream dams are expensive but can block part of the water before it reaches dams downstream), raise their dams to increase capacity, and build long tunnels to divert water to their powerhouses. Water is never consumed — its flow is just used to produce energy — and released in the rivers, so you have to strategically place your dams to recover water diverted by you and other players.

Over five rounds, players must fulfill power requirements represented by a common competitive power track and meet specific requests of personal contracts. At the same time, by placing a limited number of engineers, they attempt to increase their machineries to acquire new and more efficient construction actions and to build and activate special unique effect buildings to customize their own developing strategy.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
In 30 seconds, players write down three items from a category card they think will match the answers of a chosen player (the Ringleader), in order to score points. The first player to ring the bell may also score bonus points.

Game includes 336 categories on 168 cards, score sheets, Dead Ringer bell, 30-second timer, rules.

Battle of the Sexes has 880 questions or actions divided into five card categories. For every question your team answers correctly, a trophy is moved closer to your team's Winner's Circle. Earn three trophies to win.

Each team can use Challenge Tokens. These Tokens could either propel you to an easy victory, or send you backwards. If your team doesn't know the answer to an Our Facts, Our Stuff, Our Pics, or Our Lives question, but you think the other team doesn’t know the answer either, you can throw the question back at them by playing one of your challenge tokens. If they answer incorrectly, move the trophy towards your side of the board. If they answer correctly, move the trophy towards their side of the board. Each team only has 3 Challenge Tokens.

A simplified dungeon-crawl RPG system, Heroes & Treasure moves traditional D&D-style gaming into a game playable by kids as young as 4, while still retaining the essence of FRPGs.

Players choose their characters from the four basic character classes, Fighter, Cleric, Wizard, and Rogue. Each class has different weapons, spells, and abilities, represented by color-coded dice that simplify to-hit, armor class, damage, and criticals into one roll, easily understood at any age.

The game is moderated by an adult Quest Master, who guides the adventure party through a campaign of 10 maps. This adventure gradually introduces standard RPG concepts such as spells, doors, locks, potions, stun, invisibility, traps, levers, and more. As characters progress through the dungeon levels, they grow in power and have more choices to make in how they play.

Heroes & Treasure is played on a modular board made up of large tiles, and each character and enemy is represented by stand-up pieces.

A men vs. women game similar to Battle of the Sexes. The board has a figure-eight looped track with a side for men and a side for women. A die is rolled, and a pawn moves along the track. Rather than certain types of cards printed on spaces, there are two spinners to show what to do for that round. There is a start space on one end, a "stop" space in the middle where the tracks meet, and a finish spot at the other end of the board.

item.description:
'Twas the night before Christmas, when all through the house
Not a creature was stirring, not even a mouse;
But stillness is for those with no autopsy,
For the dead were enjoying a Christmas soiree!
The stockings were hung by the chimney with care,
In one was a foot, though we knew not from where;
The banshee shrieked carols of Christmases past,
And all within earshot lost sanity fast;
My friend, Dr. Jekyll, joined in the refrain,
But I knew that within, Hyde sneered in disdain;
With the mummy's own linen, he wrapped Christmas gifts,
Each containing a tablet of cursed hieroglyphs;
The witch mixed a potion of expensive liqueur,
Which the vampyre spurned, preferring cruor;
The ghost and the zombie had a small Christmas fight,
On which was more deader, the undead or the geist;
With twice seeing eyes, Franky took it all in.
His very first Christmas, about to begin;
But I thought I heard rustling out in the snow,
And I spied out my window Van Helsing's crossbow;
The hunter had found us and we had a plight,
For Franky had not learned of Christmas delights;
He let fly his arrow but it fell with a flub,
For his cloak had been caught on a thorn in the shrub;
Without wasting a moment to thank our landscaper,
We escaped in the night to continue our caper;
But we know he's still out there acting like an ass,
Determined to make Franky's 1st Christmas his last;
All the monsters are scared and I need assistance,
To help overcome their foolish resistance;
I beg you, dear reader, help Franky today,
Just download the game, print it, and play;

In Franky's 1st Christmas you must guide Franky to the lairs of 6 monster so that they can teach him their favorite thing about Christmas. Meanwhile, Van Helsing will be investigating the monsters and hunting them when he can.

Each monster card has two sides. The front includes their ability to persuade other monsters and a special power. The backside shows their Christmas lesson and how nervous they are to teach it. The Dr. Jekyll card is slightly different - he doesn't teach a Christmas Lesson. Rather, he turns into a Mr. Hyde. Mr. Hyde can still be used, but he's far more clumsy and less efficient than Dr. Jekyll.

The monsters will roll dice to try and convince each other to teach Franky his Christmas lessons. Each monster has distinct success values, making each roll in the game unique. Some monsters may instead use a special power to distract Van Helsing from his investigation or give other monsters a benefit. How the monsters use their actions is entirely up to you!

Each turn has 7 phases.
1. Roll Random Event - This will usually move Van Helsing further along in his investigation or give the monsters better luck in their attempts to teach Franky.
2. Select a monster to teach Franky a Christmas Lesson
3. The other monsters take actions to persuade the teaching monster to do its job.
4. Check to see if Dr. Jekyll transforms into Mr. Hyde.
5. Reset the cards and get ready for the next turn.

You win the game by teaching Franky all 6 lessons of Christmas and escaping from Van Helsing.

link.value: 9 Card Game Print and Play Design Contest

item.description:
Zombie Road is a blood spillin', Zombie killin' race to the Oasis for 2-4 players!

Zombie Road allows you to choose between an awesome group characters, each with a unique ability, and attempt to accumulate enough miles to escape to a zombie-free zone. Watch out for disasters, stock up at gas stations and keep your guns loaded because zombies could be lurking nearby! Do you and your fellow survivors have what it takes to survive?

During each turn, a player will draw one card from the deck and then has one action to either kill a Zombie (if drawn), Remedy a disaster or accumulate miles...reach 100 miles to win the game!

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Are you ready to run? Push your luck in the video game world of Megaland to fight monsters (and bunnies) and collect coins!

At the start of each round, each player places their character on the level tile, then draws one treasure and places it above their character board. Once everyone does this, draw the topmost level card to see whether players suffer damage from the monster on it. Players can then decide whether to leave the round and bank their treasures, or whether to press on; if they go on, they draw another treasure card, then reveal the next level card. If you take total damage equal to your number of hearts, you fail and are out of the round, losing any treasure that you had.

Once everyone has left the round, whether by being knocked out or by passing and banking their treasures, players can buy building cards, such as bowling alleys, arcades, and soap makers. Buildings cost 1-5 treasures, and you must pay different treasures when buying a building that costs more than 1. Each building gives a one-time or permanent effect. Maybe you'll collect jump tokens that you can use to clear monsters so that you don't take damage; maybe you'll acquire a hospital that gives you coins when neighboring players fail the level; maybe you'll buy more hearts to let you run farther in the future; and maybe you'll collect coins, which can be the most precious item of all since the game ends after the round that someone collects 20 coins. Whoever has the most coins at that time wins!

Megaland contains six starred building types that are used in each game, along with seventeen other building types, with only seven of them being used in any game.

name.value: Sonic The Hedgehog: The Card Game

item.description:
50 Large Cards featuring your favorite Sonic the Hedgehog characters!

Great fun and easy to play! The first to get rid of all their cards is the winner. Beware though, in this game of thrills and spills, you won't be able to win quite as easily as you suspect!

—description from the back of the box

In this variation on UNO, the deck of cards is dealt evenly out to all players. Each player places his or her deck face down in front of them. The player who is to the left of the dealer turns over the top card of his or her deck. If it is a ring card they place it next to their deck. If it is a character card, they can play it to the center of the table.

Players can play an enemy character card on an opponents hero character card to engage in a battle. Players will use one of their ring cards to 'boost' their character in the battle. However, this card is chosen in secret and revealed simultaneously. The player with the smaller ring card is the loser of the battle and takes all cards from the battle and places them in his or her discard pile.

Play continues until one player runs out of cards and is declared the winner.

—user summary

Quest! is a tableau-building game in which your charter hires adventurers, equips them, and sends them out on quests in order to gain glory for your charter!

Each player is dealt a random charter which gives starting gold, a starting adventurer, and has a unique way to end the game.

On your turn you take to actions from among Acquire Cards, Activate a Card, Amass Wealth, Embark on a Quest, Mend Your Party, Reset a Row, or Retire Cards.

You can acquire adventurers or items for your adventurers by spending the gold gained from amassing wealth or from completing quests. Once embarked on a quest, a player must complete a series of tasks as stated on the quest card by rolling dice and checking for success. If a player succeeds at a majority of the tasks, that player retains the quest and gains its reward. Fail too many tasks and suffer the consequences.

Once a player has retained enough quests to fulfill the charter's end game condition, the game ends. Each player counts the number of glory points on each quest they have retained they have won for their charter and the person with the most wins the game!

-description from designer

In Neverland: The Lost Memories players are grumpy old men who are trying to use the magic of Neverland to become younger and to recollect the lost memories of their youth. They do this with a unique blend of pick up and delivery and action drafting in a race to become the youngest player.

—description from the publisher

vIn Outbreak: Contingency Plan you are responsible for a colony trying to survive during a epidemic; this virus has a death toll that is rising by the minute.

Each player is the leader of a colony of people that are in danger of becoming extinct at almost any moment. Players will roll a die to determine their fate from the chance tokens that will cure, contaminate or cut-down your colony before you know it. Be the last remaining leader with a colony to win this fast-paced game of survival.

Will your colony survive to the end? We shall see…

—description from the publisher

Brave knights take up their lances, tighten their saddles, and mount their birds. Who can defeat the most foes, capture the most eggs, and truly gain the glory of being the world's best at Joust?

Joust brings the classic video arcade game to the tabletop in an action-packed, strategy board game. Requiring players to manage the speed and altitude of their knight, Joust features a unique momentum system that has players playing cards that immediately move their knight, but repeat effects for turns to come. Act quickly, but think ahead, because in the game of Joust speed can be your greatest ally — or biggest foe.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
Description: Take on the role of Squirrel, Bear, Deer, Rabbit, Beaver, or Fox as you try to get the "Chunkiest" and Hunker down before winter arrives.

Gameplay: Players gain points by foraging for resources, playing food cards, and Hunkering down before weather events, among others. Using an action-point allowance system, players move their pawns around the board, forage, build shelters, and manage a growing hand of powerful Food Cards. As the game progresses, players are directed to place snow tiles onto the board to show the approach of winter, turning the board into a wintry landscape. Players may use this snow strategically to hinder their opponents. Gameplay includes a press-your-luck mechanic having to do with predicting when certain detrimental seasonal events will strike. Game is turn-based, but animals' unique "Instinctive Abilities" and certain Food Cards allow players to act on others' turns, keeping them engaged even when it's not their turn.

Replayability: The game has high replayability due to its inclusion of a modular/evolving board, animals with asymmetric strengths, weaknesses, and abilities to play as, an array of randomly selected seasonal events, and multiple proven strategies to earn victory.

name.value: Sol 3: Starfighter Mech Tactics Card Game

item.description:
In Sol 3, two players face off in tactical combat, using a combination of constructed decks and selected cards, collectively known as a player’s “List”. Players create a map using a grid of map tiles, and then play proceeds in alternating turns. Each turn, the active player draws cards from their deck, moves their Capital and launches units, then activates their Units one at a time. Playing Pilots and Tactics cards is done by spending Command, which is generated each turn by a player’s Crew cards.

Each player brings a selection of Missions to the game. Each mission, when completed, grants it’s owner Victory Points. The first player to succeed in reaching the set number of Victory Points (12 in a standard “Cruiser Clash” game) wins the game. Alternatively, if a player is required to draw or discard a card from their deck, but no longer has any cards in their deck, they immediately lose the game, and their opponent wins via a “morale” victory.

—description from the designer

1 Zillion BC is a fast-paced game for two to six frenemies. Each player must lead their village and grow the population, all while maintaining a food supply before winter. The first person to reach the population goal at the end of his/ her turn is the winner. sounds simple enough, although, disasters may lay in wait either by a player or of nature that may prevent your victory.
—description from the publisher

item.description:
Beat This Book! is an exciting solo player game in a spiral-bound book format, where you (the player) take on a series of clever casino-style challenges using a deck of standard playing cards. To win the game, you MUST get to the last page in the book before running out of cards. But it won't be easy...

The challenges are woven into a continuous narrative that propels you forward in the story. You have been sent an urgent Royal Invitation from The King and Queen of Monaco -- and must set sail immediately to the Grand Hotel Victoria & Casino. But why??

Beat This Book! encompasses the elements that players most enjoy at the gaming tables: The thrill of the hard fought win, the luck of the draw, the crucial decision making, the push to keep going even in the face of diminishing odds, the flip of the cards, and of course the downright fun.

It is recommended for players aged 10 and up. The ability to read and handle a deck of cards is all that’s needed to play.

The game is a quest, an extremely dangerous quest. Dr. Henry Armitage, Chief Librarian, needs you to search the perilous Restricted Collection for fragments of lore from among the grimoires to recover pieces of a particular sigil.

Miskatonic University: The Restricted Collection lasts five rounds, and each round continues until no one is left in the library, each player having left voluntarily or having been expelled. Basic play consists of taking turns to select a library card and placing these cards face up on your player mats. Library cards come in three types: sigil pieces, grimoire fragments, and graduate students. In more detail:


 Sigil pieces: Three pieces make a set and earn a lore card. Picking up a duplicate leads to expulsion unless you can use your defenses.



 Grimoire fragments: Three pieces make a set and earn a lore card. Picking up a duplicate leads to expulsion unless you can use your defenses.



 Graduate students: Collecting four means you can re-use one of your defense cards.


Players have a chance to win black or red sanity cards, which increase your score. The game ends when the final fifth round is played. You then add up all the score cards you have received and the player with the highest score wins!

item.description:
You are a dwarf and dwarves dig; it is a matter of pride and honor. But very few can join you among the ranks of the best. In a magical mine, pickaxe in hand, you race together or separately to claim the prestige your skills can earn.

Since its discovery, the King has been anxious to delve ever further and explore the magical properties in this mountain's incredibly gem-rich region. Answering the call, the best among the dwarves are ready to explore them. This is what Dwarves thrive on -- an absolute Gem Rush!

You alone, or with up to six of your friends, can play Gem Rush as competing or cooperating dwarves in a magical mine. Using your special skill to advantage and through the clever positioning of the rooms you clear and claim for the King, you must navigate each room's special ability through the clever acquisition and use of Gem cards.

Gem Rush: Second Edition includes:
• A bright new graphics facelift for the rooms, gems, characters, skills, and even the rulebook.
• Play alongside your friends in Cooperative Mode, or see who the best dwarf is in Competitive Mode.
• New magical gems including Echoglass, Orichalcum, and Warpstone -- each with properties that impact a sagacious player's strategy.
• Player Skill cards so each dwarf wields an individual special ability which helps them compete. Includes dwarven poetry!

Game Data:
Number of Players: 1-7
Ages: 14 and up
Playing Time: Approximately 30-60 minutes

What's In The Box?:
• 80 Room cards (square)
• 7 Player Aid cards
• 75 Gem cards
• 20 Skill cards
• 7 Character standees
• 57 Point gems
• 1 First player marker
• 1 Rulebook

item.description:
Build your portfolio, start your own rumor and rise to be the wealthiest stock trader!

Stockastic is an educative boardgame about stock trading. The game aims to teach the player of basic understanding of the stock market. in this game, players will learn about how important information is in stock trading, what factors affect the price of the market and how to decide on what stock to buy for greater profits.

In Stockastic, you begin your stock trading journey with limited amount of fund. Buy and sell from the market or another player. Make sure you pay for invaluable information to maximize your profit and asses your risk.

At the start of every round, all players can bet certain amount of coins to determine who makes the first move. seize the advantage of being the first player by betting extra coins!

The price of a stock is ever-changing. Evaluate the action that benefits you the most to receive the best possible outcome!

Players are allowed to spend their fund to get various informations regarding the market. Use this information wisely to determine your actions.

You can also convince other players to buy your stocks or sell their stocks to you to gain mutual benefit. Sometimes, trading with other player might be a better option than trading in the market.

At the end of each turn, you will gain dividend based on the stocks you own. It does not matter how you play it, your goal is to be the richest stock trader in the game. Gather as much profit as possible before the game ends!

Event cards represent the events happening at the end of the semester. The card may affect either performance of a company or price of a stock, sometimes both.

Rumor cards are card that can be bought during the game and will be placed on a company board. During resolution phase, all the rumors will be revealed and could affect the price of stock.

For a more advanced gameplay, character cards are included in every set as a game mode variant. Playing as these characters will help you understand how different background of trader affect the behavior in stock trading. Every character comes with unique ability that can be used throughout the game.

name.value: Napoleon and his Marshals: The Dice Game

item.description:
Napoleon and his Marshals - The Dice Game is a fast playing wargame covering several years of Napoleonic warfare. The game includes two scenarios, one for two player and one for multiplayer.

The game uses a map divided into areas and dice for the counters. The strength is represented by the number of pips. These pips determine the number of dice that can be rolled in combat as well.

Each country represented in the game is handicapped so the game can be ended at any point and determine the final score. The game is designed to introduce new players to Napoleonic games or for experienced players to get a quick game in.

—description from the publisher

Ruby Monsters is a "sister work" to Diamonsters, using the same art with some rules changes. Like the other game it uses a "butting" mechanic similar to Hol's der Geier.

Players have a hand consisting of monster cards numbered 1-5. Each turn a card is drawn from the treasure deck, which can be a ruby card (with 1, 2, or 3 rubies) or a skull card. Everyone picks a monster from their hand and reveals it at the same time. If two players put out the same number those cards are removed, and then the highest card wins, except 1 beats 5. The winner removes the monster they used from their hand and the losers get their monsters back.

There are three ways to win: get a total of five rubies, get two skulls, or get four treasure cards of any kind.

—user summary

Pacific Victory covers the war in the Pacific during World War II using the Columbia Block game system. Units are represented by wooden blocks which remain upright and hide the type and strength of the unit. A fusion of Columbia's older "Front" system and its newer "Victory" system, the game focuses on the grand strategy of the Pacific war. It provides a number of scenarios that deal with specific stages of the war and also a grand campaign.

Second Edition contains:

 Large 9 panel mapboard
 2 sets Rules v2.5, in color with improved balance and victory conditions
 8 6-sided dice
 132 wood blocks plus some replacements in four (4) colors: 
 orange: IJN, 66 blocks; 
 blue: US, 39;
 brown: British, Indian, ANZAC, 17; 
 yellow: China, 10. 
 
 Block artwork is new.

Pun Pong is the first game from publisher Bread and Circuses. The game pits two team of punsters against each other in a head to head battle of wits and words.

One Pun card is drawn for the table, along with a rules card which sets up a specific guideline like making your Puns rhyme, or they must be included in sentences to form an ongoing puntastic story.

Teams bounce their puns back and forth until one team becomes stumped or repeats a pun, then the round is over.

The first team to 8 points wins.

Different game modes are available to be accessible to all different levels of player, from the punitiate to the pro's.

-description from publisher

Ever wanted to know what it was like to work for the Easter Bunny the week before Easter? Well, hop to it and pray that you don’t have a bad hare day.

Scrambled Eggs: A Dexterity Game requires a minimum of two players, but is better with more…just bear in mind that it requires real eggs to play, so you might want to get eggs cheep – preferably in multiples of twelve as they are usually cheeper by the dozen.

Players will prepare the eggs ahead of time (removing the yolk and whites leaving the shell), color as they please and they are ready to begin!

Players will scramble to get as many of the eggs from the central playing area into their own bowl. Using chopsticks, players transfer the eggs to their bowl. If an egg cracks, points will be deducted from their total.

The round ends when all eggs are removed from the central bowl. Players should play the best of three rounds with as many intact eggs that remain. The player who has obtained the most eggs over the three rounds, minus the eggs the player broke, scores the most points and wins the game.

Submission for the April 2018 24-Hour Game Design Contest.

name.value: BattleTech Alpha Strike: Support Lance Pack

item.description:
Description:

The Support Lance Pack is a collection of four plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also provides eight dry-erase cards, six of which are intended to directly support Alpha Strike gameplay.

From the back cover:

“Reinforcements!
Support lance MechWarriors are the unsung workhorses of every army. Overlooked by most, commanders know these stalwarts are the glue that binds any military, enabling success for any type of military campaign...

Unleash the Support Lance Pack on your enemies! Awesome, Vindicator, Firestarter and Charger BattleMechs—no assembly required. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike heavy metal action!”

Contents:

Four plastic miniatures
- Awesome
- Charger
- Firestarter
- Vindicator

Eight dry-erase cards (dual-sided)
Alpha Strike
AWS-8Q Awesome / AWS-9M Awesome
Jeff X. Mink Awesome / Awesome Mink (profile)
CGR-1A1 Charger / CGR-3K Charger
FS9-H Firestarter / FS9-S Firestarter
LNC25-01 Lancelot / LNC25-02 Lancelot
VND-1AA "Avenging Angel" Vindicator / VND-1R Vindicator

Information:

This last card's "B" side describes Alpha Strike Companion, Technical Readout: 3039, Technical Readout: 3050 Upgrade, and the Lancelot bonus card (highlighting the pewter miniature available from Iron Wind Metals), with the product code for each.

Morse Karuta (ãƒ¢ã‚¦ãƒ«ã‚¹ã‚«ãƒ«ã‚¿) is a card game based on Morse code, with players trying to recognize code in order to claim cards.

The game includes two ways to play, one for younger players and one for older ones. In the first game, you lay out 18 cards on the table so that their black-and-white images and their names (in English and Morse code) are visible on them. After downloading the game app to your phone, one player is chosen as the parent, who then chooses a card and taps out the Morse code repeatedly on the phone app. Whichever child, a term that encompasses everyone else, touches the right card first claims that card and becomes the parent for the next round. If a child touches the wrong card, they're out for the round.

When only five cards remain on the table, the game ends, then players flip over the cards to reveal their colors, and the app then assigns a point value (1-3) to each of the three colors. Players then tally their scores, and whoever has the most points wins.

In the other game, you lay out the 18 cards color-side up. Two Morse code player aides are placed on the table as well. The current parent secretly chooses one of the cards, then taps out the Morse code of a word related to that card; for a card depicting the sun, the parent might tap out the Morse code for "sun", "summer", "heat", or another word that seems appropriate. Once again, whoever touches the right card first claims it and becomes the new parent.

In Patrimonium, players set out to discover the Walloon heritage. Through a series of 9 "families" of monuments and sites, the players get a broad view of the richness and diversity of this regional heritage.

Patrimonium looks very much like a mix between Happy Families and Mille Bornes, with cards representing castles, churches, gardens and other sites of the Walloon heritage.

name.value: Ziggurat: The mythical ascension of the desert rose, the waking sun and the scholar princess

item.description:
Ziggurat is an artistic and immersive solitaire board game set in fantasy desert tower, in a world ruled by manipulators of substance.

In order to climb to the top of the tower Ziggurat, players will have to chose their path room by room, each time triggering one of 7 mini-games.

To help them in their quest, the characters will use metals they find to craft alchemical recipes in the labs they find in the tower.

While the full climb can take many hours to complete, the game can be broken into sessions of approximately 15 minutes and easily saved, to be recovered later, thanks to the game's quick setup.

—description from the designer

Introduction:
Quest for Esmeralda is a strategy-based, Simultaneous Action Selection battle game with medieval theme. Players each take a role as an adventurer on a quest to retrieve the treasure called Esmeralda. It’s every man for himself, and players must defeat everyone else before reaching Esmeralda. However, Esmeralda is heavily guarded by the Dragon... How will you defeat all opponents, slain the Dragon and retrieve Esmeralda?

Gameplay:
Each player is dealt a hand from a small deck of 12 cards. The deck is designed to be exhaustive, and players can deduce what other players have, based on what's been played.
Players battle each other in multiple Battles, each consisting of Turns. 
At the beginning of every Turn, each player secretly chooses an action and their target. All cards are revealed at once, and the actions are resolved accordingly. If you accumulate enough damage, you are out for that Battle and cannot join until the next Battle. Don't worry, Battles typically only last 3 Turns.
After every turn, surviving players get to move their pawn down the world map towards Esmeralda. Each point on the map, however, has a location card which may be beneficial or detrimental to the players. The last point on the world map is Esmeralda, defended by the Dragon. When fighting the Dragon, his health never heals. This means that sneaky players can swoop in and deal the last hit to win the game!

Frequently Asked Questions:

Is this a player elimination game?
Yes, however the elimination is temporary. Players always come back to life after every Battle. It's no fun when players get eliminated and they have to sit around for the rest of the game!

Will it be hard for losing players to win the game?
Nope! The game is designed for quick battles with balancing mechanisms everywhere.

What will I need to play the PnP version?
You will need 4 pairs of matching pawns, and 1 unique pawn.

In Doxie Dash, you get to join the pack by selecting a hero with their own unique set of abilities; use them to establish your dominance. Take on challenges from the doxie's perspective as you defeat foes, poo on expensive rugs, hoard skivvies, and lick your way to victory.

Game play is quick and simple. Draft cards, gamble, sabotage, and use your hero's variable player powers to defeat your challengers. This is your chance to prove that you are the ultimate wiener.

Perfect for ages 6+, this game plays well with 2 to 6 players. You can expect each game to take about 20 minutes. If you're hungry for a longer gameplay experience, you can enjoy the Team Play or Tournament option. With treats to collect and enemies lurking around every corner, do you have what it takes to become top dog? Because there can be only one wiener!

item.description:
One spring day, Hans, the family’s mischievous golden retriever goes nuts over the yummy treats.

In an attempt to hide the Milka biscuits in his dog house, he accidentally scatters them all over the place. The Biscuit Jars then set off on an adventure to collect as many biscuits as they can.

They’re not going to let Hans have all the fun!
